SlowDown.synopsis: The player senses a windmill's rotation slow or halt entirely, or speed up, after the player changed the speed. If present, some goblins go to investigate the disturbance.

AD_RotatingFasterReaction.synopsis: Said while being spun faster on the pane of a windmill. Should be in a panic.

AD_UnfortunateGnomeFreed.synopsis: After being let off the pane of the windmill.

AD_Plead.synopsis: Fezzerk the goblin calls up to his captive, Barcus Wroot, who is being spun on the blade of a windmill, mocking his efforts to attract help.

AD_WaitingForRelease.synopsis: Barcus shouts for help - the windmill he's tied to is rotating, and he needs someone to halt it before he can be cut loose. Urgent, at the end of his tether

AD.synopsis: If the player gets the windmill to stop spinning, then clicks Barcus, Barcus will get these lines. Barcus will be impatient, mistrustful of the player, but still in need of player's help.

TiedUp.synopsis: The player has stopped the windmill from rotating and can now cut Barcus Wroot, the captive gnome, free from its sails. They can do this immediately, or else demand payment first, much to the gnome's frustration.
TiedUp.how_to_trigger: - Go to 18 416- Get through the goblins by playing as a drow and forcing them to leave- Go to the back of the windmill (-11 428) and flick the release brake lever- Talk to the gnome

AD_UnfortunateGnomePikeFail.synopsis: Player failed to untie Barcus from the windmill.

individual_metadata.synopsis: The player speaks to a deep gnome after freeing him from some goblins, who'd had him tied to the sail of a windmill. The player discovers that the deep gnome travelled to the region as he learned his old friend is in danger. By way of thanks, he provides the player with the means to craft smokepowder, an explosive item. He then leaves for the Underdark in search of his friend. There, the player may encounter him again.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 0.60, 36.99, 424.644. Resolve the dialog with goblin or kill everyone.5. go to the lever in the windmill and choose the "brake" one.6. Talk to Barcus and choose to free him.

SpeedUp.synopsis: Narration - the player senses the windmill's rotation is speeding up after a brake is released.

Dead.synopsis: This is the gnome's spirit once he's dead. He's still focused on Wulbren, his first love, who he believes to be in danger.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Several sessions form parts of two alternative branches relating to the windmill’s changing speed and the subsequent fate of the captive gnome, Barcus. One branch deals with the windmill slowing down and allowing the player to try to free Barcus, while the other branch involves the windmill speeding up, causing an immediate panic reaction. In the slowing branch, Barcus first calls for help (AD_WaitingForRelease) while still tied to a rotating windmill. The player then intervenes, which is sensed as a change in windmill speed (SlowDown). Once the windmill slows or stops, Barcus can be clicked to trigger his annoyed dialogue (AD). At that point the player must act – either attempting to free him by cutting his bindings (TiedUp) which can result in either a successful freeing (AD_UnfortunateGnomeFreed) or a failure (AD_UnfortunateGnomePikeFail). These two outcomes are mutually exclusive. In a different branch the windmill speeds up (SpeedUp) upon a brake being released; as a consequence, someone on the windmill (presumably the captive) reacts in panic (AD_RotatingFasterReaction). Moreover, because the windmill either slows or speeds up, the two sessions (SlowDown and SpeedUp) do not coexist in the same narrative path. Finally, the gnome’s eventual death (Dead) is an alternate outcome to being freed, so if the freeing dialogue (AD_UnfortunateGnomeFreed) occurs then the 'Dead' session should not occur. Only sessions with clear ordering or exclusiveness constraints have been included.

SlowDown_4.speaker: Fezzerk
SlowDown_4.text: What's goin' on back there? Go check it out!
SlowDown_4.context: NodeContext: He turns to his right as he tells the other goblins to check it out.

SlowDown_12.speaker: Narrator
SlowDown_12.context: NodeContext: Intentionally blank for cinematic purposes

SlowDown_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unfortunate Gnome gets flung off.

SlowDown_7.speaker: Fezzerk
SlowDown_7.text: What the...? Our birdy just flew away!

AD_Plead_2.context: NodeContext: mocking barcus as he (barcus) flies on the windmill pane.

AD_Plead_7.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_Plead_7.context: NodeContext: Calling down to a goblin who has him captive on the windmill. Said while spinning on windmill.

AD_Plead_3.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_Plead_3.text: Go on then! Make it good!
AD_Plead_3.context: NodeContext: mocking barcus as he (barcus) flies on the windmill pane. Responding to, 'let me down, i'm about to hurl!'

AD_Plead_8.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_Plead_8.context: NodeContext: Barcus Wroot calls out for help from someone - anyone - while tied to the sail of a windmill. He's hollering at the top of his lungs from an elevated position, trying to get attention.

AD_Plead_4.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_Plead_4.text: Scream all you like! Nobody's listening.

AD_WaitingForRelease_0.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_WaitingForRelease_0.context: NodeContext: Barcus shouts for help - the windmill he's tied to is rotating, and he needs someone to halt it before he can be cut loose. Urgent, at the end of his tether.

AD_WaitingForRelease_1.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_WaitingForRelease_1.context: NodeContext: Barcus is still tied to the sail of a windmill, but it's no longer rotating, Impatient to be released.

TiedUp_2.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome is tied to the (stationary) sail of a wind, begging to be cut free by the player. He's close to the ground and within normal speaking range.NodeContext: Urgent, panicked. The gnome begs to be untied from the sail of a windmill. The sail is at the lowermost part of its rotation in relation to the ground, and the gnome is within normal speaking range.

TiedUp_0.speaker: Player
TiedUp_0.context: NodeContext: Incredulous. His good samaritan seems to be haggling for a reward before even freeing him.

TiedUp_10.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp_10.context: NodeContext: Impatient. He's used to being extorted.

TiedUp_3.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp_3.text: Come on! What are you waiting for?!
TiedUp_3.context: NodeContext: The gnome grows exasperated and panicky over the player's delay in cutting him free.

AD_UnfortunateGnomePikeFail_0.speaker: Player
AD_UnfortunateGnomePikeFail_0.context: NodeContext: The player mutters to themselves as they struggle to untie a bound hostage in need of aid.

1.speaker: Barcus Wroot
1.text: Urrrgh... magga cammara - those pustulent thugs!
1.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/actor context - the deep gnome sways dizzilyNodeContext: 'Magga cammara' pronounced 'Mag-ah cam-ah-rah'. Gnomish exclamation meaning 'by the stones'.
Barcus the deep gnome is suffering some grogginess after spinning on the sail of a windmill for the last while.

16.speaker: Barcus Wroot
16.context: NodeContext: Still a little out of sorts after his ordeal spinning on a windmill, now a mixture of resigned and annoyed. He's expecting you to extort him now.

3.speaker: Barcus Wroot
3.text: I'm a deep gnome, you're a drow. You helped me, now you plan to enslave me.

14.speaker: Barcus Wroot
14.text: What, then? Torture? Bloodsport? Or perhaps just a good old-fashioned walloping?

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I freed you. A little compensation would be nice.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I freed you. A little compensation would be nice.

42.speaker: Barcus Wroot
42.text: As expected. Coercion by the book.

50.speaker: Barcus Wroot
50.text: Compensation? Is that all? I expected worse from the likes of you.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Is that what you think of drow?

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I'd rather know how you got caught.

33.speaker: Barcus Wroot
33.text: My own fault, really. I should have dropped my pack and outrun those bastards. Alas.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: I could extort you, if that's what you want.

2.speaker: Barcus Wroot
2.text: You're teasing me now. I'm certain of it.

37.speaker: Barcus Wroot
37.text: Take my pack if you can find it. The only reason those goblins caught me was its weight. I'll travel lightly from now on.
37.context: InternalNodeContext: Has not offered pack yet.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: You're a little far from home for a deep gnome.

20.speaker: Barcus Wroot
20.text: Ignorance is alive and well, it seems! Deep gnomes aren't restricted to the Underdark, you know - I've lived in Baldur's Gate for years.

51.speaker: Barcus Wroot
51.text: I'm in search of a friend. I fear he's in trouble. See this? I gave it to him years ago before I left home.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: He shows his blood-speckled amulet to the player.

8.speaker: Barcus Wroot
8.text: I found it around the neck of a thug in the Lower City. It was speckled with blood, my friend nowhere to be found.
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: He shows his blood-speckled amulet to the player.

47.speaker: Barcus Wroot
47.text: But I still have hope. I have reason to believe he's in the Underdark. Hopefully I'll pick up his trail from there.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: He shows his blood-speckled amulet to the player.

29.speaker: Barcus Wroot
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks player up and down judgementally, player should wonder 'is he talking about me?'He shows his blood-speckled amulet to the player.InternalNodeContext: He hasn't given player the pack yet.

31.speaker: Barcus Wroot
31.text: On that note, I bid thee farewell. If we should meet again... well, we will have met again.
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: He puts away his blood-speckled amulet

5.speaker: Barcus Wroot
5.text: I'm in search of a friend. I fear he's in trouble. He had this locket, see, that I gave him years ago before leaving home.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

55.speaker: Barcus Wroot
55.text: I found it around the neck of a thug in Baldur's Gate. It was speckled with blood, my friend nowhere to be found.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

32.speaker: Barcus Wroot
32.text: But I still have hope. I have reason to believe he's in the Underdark. Hopefully I'll pick up his trail from there.
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

12.speaker: Barcus Wroot
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks player up and down judgementally, player should wonder 'is he talking about me?'InternalNodeContext: He hasn't given player the pack yet.

4.speaker: Barcus Wroot
4.text: On that note, I bid thee farewell. If we should meet again... well, we will have met again.
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: He says his goodbyes, turns and walks away

7.speaker: Player
7.text: You're free to continue on your way.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I walk my path, you walk yours. We may meet again - we may not. Who's to say.

38.speaker: Barcus Wroot
38.text: This is... well... most unorthodox. So it shall be.
38.context: NodeContext: a bit flustered, he's not used to this

21.speaker: Barcus Wroot
21.text: I'm a deep gnome, you're a grey dwarf. You helped me, now you plan to enslave me.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Is that what you think of duergar?

39.speaker: Barcus Wroot
39.text: You saved me. Now you'll extort me. That's how this works, yes?

46.speaker: Player
46.text: To take without need is unprincipled. You owe me nothing, gnome.

52.speaker: Barcus Wroot
52.text: Urrrgh... magga cammara - those pustulent thugs!

Dead_8.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Dead_8.text: Caught... by... goblins... killed... in... fray...

Dead_6.speaker: Player
Dead_6.text: Tell me about any valuables you have.

Dead_2.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Dead_2.text: My... pack... everything... I needed... to find him...

Dead_7.speaker: Player
Dead_7.text: Why do you need to find this Wulbren?

Dead_23.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Dead_23.text: Flames... in... the... dark... his amulet... found... bloodied...

Dead_24.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Dead_24.text: Left... the... Underdark... way home... nearby...

Dead_17.speaker: Narrator
Dead_17.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Dead_9.speaker: Narrator
Dead_9.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

Dead_15.speaker: Narrator
Dead_15.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*
